intro: Cruciata taurica subsp. persica, commonly known as the Caucasian crucifix, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is characterized by its distinctive cruciform (cross-shaped) flowers, which are typically pink or white. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
